title: Ablaye Mbengue
text:
Ablaye Vieux M'bengue (born 19 May 1992) is a <a href="Senegal">Senegal</a>ese professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player who plays as a <a href="Striker%20%28association%20football%29">striker</a>.
Career.
M'bengue began his career at <a href="ASC%20Jaraaf">ASC Jaraaf</a> before joining <a href="Sapins%20FC">Sapins</a>. In January 2015, Mbengue went on trial with Turkish <a href="TFF%20First%20League">First League</a> side <a href="Adana%20Demirspor">Adana Demirspor</a>. On 24 February 2015, M'bengue signed for <a href="Russian%20Football%20Premier%20League">Russian Premier League</a> side <a href="FC%20Terek%20Grozny">FC Terek Grozny</a>. M'bengue made his professional debut on 2 May 2015 for Terek Grozny in their Russian Premier League game against <a href="FC%20Rostov">FC Rostov</a>, coming in as a substitute shortly before half-time for the injured <a href="A%C3%ADlton%20Jos%C3%A9%20Almeida">Aílton</a>. With 7 minutes left in the game, he scored the only goal of the match, giving his team a 1–0 away victory. In his first game in the starting lineup on 11 May 2015, he scored twice to help Terek beat <a href="FC%20Spartak%20Moscow">FC Spartak Moscow</a> with a score of 4–2.
On 27 May 2019 Mbengue signed a new three-year contract with <a href="FC%20Akhmat%20Grozny">Akhmat Grozny</a>, keeping him in Grozny until the summer of 2022. In August 2020, Mbengue went <a href="AWOL%20%28disambiguation%29">AWOL</a> from Akhmat Grozny.
On 29 March 2021, Mbengue joined <a href="FC%20Dinamo%20Minsk">Dinamo Minsk</a> on loan until the end of the 2021 season from Akhmat Grozny.
On 5 October 2021, Dinamo Minsk announced that Mbengue had unilaterally terminated his loan deal with Dinamo Minsk, and contract with Akhmat Grozny, to join <a href="Maccabi%20Petah%20Tikva%20F.C.">Maccabi Petah Tikva</a>.
